TI MUONIUM FORMATION ON POWDERED PLATINUM SURFACES
SO CHEMICAL PHYSICS LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
AB Muonium formation was verified in platinum powders under vacuum by muonium spin rotation (MuSR) spectroscopy. Muonium yields of 13(1)% and 9(3)% per incident muon were obtained for Pt powders with mean particle diameters of 30 and 200 nm, respectively. The disappearance of the muonium signal under oxygenic or atmospheric environment indicates that muonium stays outside the Pt particles. It can be postulated that reactive collision between muonium and atomic oxygen is a predominant process on the platinum surface treated by hydrogen.
C1 UNIV TOKYO,FAC SCI,MESON SCI LAB,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.
RP MATSUSHITA, A (reprint author), INST PHYS & CHEM RES,WAKO,SAITAMA 35101,JAPAN.

TI LOW-ENERGY UNSTABLE NUCLEAR BEAM CHANNEL SLOW AT THE RIKEN RING
   CYCLOTRON
SO NUCLEAR INSTRUMENTS & METHODS IN PHYSICS RESEARCH SECTION B-BEAM
   INTERACTIONS WITH MATERIALS AND ATOMS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 12TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON ELECTROMAGNETIC ISOTOPE SEPARATORS AND
   TECHNIQUES RELATED TO THEIR APPLICATIONS ( EMIS-12 )
CY SEP 02-06, 1991
CL SENDAI, JAPAN
SP TOHOKU UNIV, CYCLOTRON & RADIOISOTOPE CTR, GEN COMM
AB A new type of low-energy radioactive nuclear beam channel "SLOW" has been constructed at the RIKEN ring cyclotron facility, intended not only for the study of emission mechanisms of various low-energy radioactive as well as stable isotope ions from a characterized surface of the primary target, but also for the generation of useful radioactive ion beams for surface-physics studies of the secondary target.
   In the commissioning experiment of the SLOW beam channel, the reaction products of a heavy-ion induced nuclear reaction have been observed after surface ionization at a hot tungsten target.

TI A LARGE SOLID-ANGLE SECONDARY-BEAM COLLECTOR USING AN AXIALLY
   SYMMETRICAL SUPERCONDUCTING MAGNETIC-FIELD
SO NUCLEAR INSTRUMENTS & METHODS IN PHYSICS RESEARCH SECTION B-BEAM
   INTERACTIONS WITH MATERIALS AND ATOMS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 12TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON ELECTROMAGNETIC ISOTOPE SEPARATORS AND
   TECHNIQUES RELATED TO THEIR APPLICATIONS ( EMIS-12 )
CY SEP 02-06, 1991
CL SENDAI, JAPAN
SP TOHOKU UNIV, CYCLOTRON & RADIOISOTOPE CTR, GEN COMM
ID SPECTROMETER
AB A new type of beam collector for light secondary charged particles ("Large OMEGA" beam course) was designed and constructed at the RIKEN Ring Cyclotron (RRC). It makes use of the focusing properties of an axially symmetric magnetic field produced by three short superconducting coils. The system sees the target at right angles to the primary beam, and covers a solid angle of about 600 msr. It has been used mainly to transport surface muons from the decay of pions produced in nucleus-nucleus collisions. The large collection efficiency of surface muons by this collector helped us to obtain valuable data on the production cross section of low-energy pions (below 10 MeV) in reactions of 135 MeV/u N-14 beam with various target nuclei. Its future development will also be discussed.

TI PREPARATION OF PURE TRITIUM FOR A LIQUID D2/T2 TARGET OF MUON-CATALYZED
   FUSION EXPERIMENTS
SO APPLIED RADIATION AND ISOTOPES
LA English
DT Article
ID GAS-CHROMATOGRAPHY; HYDROGEN ISOTOPES; ENRICHMENT; DT
AB To prepare a pure liquid D2/T2 target for muon-catalyzed fusion (mu-CF) experiments, 50 TBq of tritium gas was purified with gas chromatography for isotopic enrichment and with the tritide formation reaction of uranium for chemical purification. The isotopic purity of the processed tritium was as high as 99.9% and the chemical purity 99.7%. The He-3 content was 0.02% or less immediately after the preparation.
   A 300 mL (30 TBq) portion of pure T2 gas was mixed with 700 mL of pure D2 gas to be loaded into a target chamber made of stainless steel. The D2/T2 mixed gas was liquefied in the target chamber by cooling with liquid helium and irradiated with pulsed-mu- beams for more than 200 h. No characteristic muonic x-rays arising from impurities in the D2/T2 target were observed.

TI MU-SR STUDY OF NI(C2H8N2)2NO2CLO4 IN PULSED HIGH MAGNETIC-FIELDS
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 3RD INTERNATIONAL SYMP ON RESEARCH ON HIGH MAGNETIC FIELDS A SATELLITE
   OF THE 3RD INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MAGNETISM ( ICM 91 )
CY AUG 29-31, 1991
CL AMSTERDAM, NETHERLANDS
SP KONINKLIJKE NEDERLANDSE AKAD WETENSCHAPPEN, STICHTING FUNDAMENTEEL ONDERZOEK MAT, STICHTING PHYS, UNIV AMSTERDAM, KATHOLIEKE UNIV NIJMEGEN, HOEK LOOS IND GASSES, OXFORD INSTRUMENTS, ELSEVIER SCI PUBL, OCE COPIERS, IBM NEDERLAND
HO UNIV AMSTERDAM
ID ANTIFERROMAGNET NI(C2H8N2)2NO2(CLO4); HEISENBERG-ANTIFERROMAGNET
AB We have performed mu-SR experiments on a Haldane gap material [Ni(C2H8N2)2NO2Cl4O4] from room temperature down to 4.2 K in magnetic fields up to 12.5 T.  It has been found that the temperature dependence of the relaxation rate is different from that obtained by NMR because of the difference of sites and the characteristic observation time ranges between NMR and mu-SR.  The very fast relaxation time has been observed at high field and it may be ascribed to a strong internal field which comes from the superhyperfine interaction due to a strong coupling of muon with (NO2)- radical between Ni2+ ions in a chain.

TI MU-SR STUDY OF HEXAGONAL ABX3
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MAGNETISM
CY SEP 02-06, 1991
CL EDINBURGH, SCOTLAND
ID ISING ANTIFERROMAGNET; CSCOCL3
AB To elucidate the magnetic ordering process in quasi one-dimensional antiferromagnets, hexagonal ABX3 compounds which have spin frustration among the magnetic chains on the triangular lattice, mu+SR experiments were performed on a typical Ising spin system CsCoCl3.  Below T(N2) = 9 K, precession component was observed with the precession frequency extrapolated to 4.2 MHz at 0 K.  In the partially disordered phase below T(N1) = 21 K, a relaxation component of muon polarization is superimposed on the precession spectra due to static magnetic dipolar field indicating remarkable spin fluctuations despite of long range ordering.  In the paramagnetic phase, only the relaxation component was observed.  The results are interpreted in terms of domain wall solitons which propagate along the magnetic chains.  The missing signal and its temperature dependence are future problems.

TI MU-SR STUDY OF PRCO2SI2 IN PULSED HIGH MAGNETIC-FIELD
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MAGNETISM
CY SEP 02-06, 1991
CL EDINBURGH, SCOTLAND
AB Mu-SR experiments have been performed on metamagnetic PrCo2Si2 at zero field at various temperatures down to 4.2 K and at high magnetic fields up to 13 T, well above the saturation field at 4.2 K.  Large changes of the relaxation rates have been observed at the critical temperatures, where the magnetic structure changes.  At high field, the relaxation rates have been found to be large.  This effect is considered to be due to the spin fluctuations which occur in the long-period structure phases.

TI DIRECT OBSERVATION OF A DIAMAGNETIC PRODUCT IN GAS-PHASE REACTIONS OF
   MUONIUM BY MUON SPIN-RESONANCE
SO CHEMICAL PHYSICS LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
ID CHEMISTRY; KINETICS; EXCHANGE; F2
AB The diamagnetic muon spin-resonance method was developed fora reaction of Cl2 with muonium (Mu) formed in a Krand Ar atmosphere. A diamagnetic product was measured directly by the resonance method. The rate constant of its formation in Kr at 12.2 atm was 5.05(9) x 10(10) l mol-1 s-1. By comparison with the rate constant of Mu decay measured by the muon spin-rotation method, it is concluded that MuCl produced from Mu in collision with Cl2 is detected as the diamagnetic-mu+ by the resonance method and that Mu decays either through a chemical reaction with Cl2 or Mu-spin depolarization caused by slowing-down of mu+.  A similar experiment in Ar suggests formation of other products.

TI MUON SCIENCE RESEARCH WITH PULSED MUONS AT UT-MSL KEK
SO ZEITSCHRIFT FUR PHYSIK C-PARTICLES AND FIELDS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT INTERNATIONAL SYMP ON THE FUTURE OF MUON PHYSICS
CY MAY 07-09, 1991
CL HEIDELBERG, GERMANY
SP STATE BADEN WURTTEMBERG, COHERNET, DEUT FORSCHUNGSGEMEINSCH, UNIV HEIDELBERG, BALZERS HOCHVAKUUM, IBM GERMANY
HO RUPREDCHT KARLS UNIV
ID POSITIVE MUONS; SPIN-RESONANCE; FACILITY; BEAM
AB The facility construction as well as scientific achievements during the first 10 years operation of the Meson Science Laboratory, University of Tokyo (UT-MSL) located at KEK are summarized with special emphasis on the advantage of the use of sharply pulsed muon beam for new types of muon science experiments. Also, a short description is given on the nearest future project of ultra-slow mu+ facility.

TI MUONIUM FLUORESCENCE - ANOMALOUS MUONIUM CENTER AND RELAXED
   EXCITED-STATE IN KBR
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
ID ATOMIC-HYDROGEN; ALKALI-HALIDES; ENDOR; KCL
AB A slowly decaying fluorescence [lifetime congruent-to 13.3(5)mu-s] induced by implanted positive muons has been observed in KBr by using the time-resolved direct-photon-counting method with a total yield of one photon per four incident muons below 30 K. The temperature dependence of the fluorescence yield shows a remarkable coincidence with that of the amplitude of the anomalous muonium center in KBr observed by the muon-spin-rotation method, strongly suggesting a coupled state between muonium centers and radiation-induced relaxed excited states as a model for the anomalous muonium centers.

TI COSEISMIC CHANGES OF SUBSURFACE GAS COMPOSITIONS DISCLOSED BY AN
   IMPROVED SEISMO-GEOCHEMICAL SYSTEM
SO GEOPHYSICAL RESEARCH LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
ID EARTHQUAKE; GROUNDWATER; WATER; JAPAN
AB An automatic system for seismo-geochemical observation has been improved to monitor small changes in subsurface gas composition.  This system is computer-based and consists of an on-site monitoring unit for gas analyses and a telemetry unit for transmitting the observation data to our laboratory.  The analytical data with this system showed three coseismic anomalies in spring gas compositions at a monitoring station for these 11 months.  These anomalies were associated with a far (and large) earthquake or two small (and near) ones, respectively.  The gas anomaly as a spike-like signal appears only for a short period and can be detected on the basis of temporally dense data provided by the new system.  The result shows that the behavior of subsurface gases is sensitive to crustal movements.
RP NAGAMINE, K (reprint author), NAGOYA UNIV,DEPT EARTH SCI,NAGOYA 46401,JAPAN.

TI SUPERCONDUCTING, ELECTRONIC AND MAGNETIC-ANOMALIES DUE TO STRUCTURAL
   TRANSITION AROUND X=0.12 IN LA2-XBAXCUO4
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 3RD INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MATERIALS AND MECHANISMS OF SUPERCONDUCTIVITY
   : HIGH TEMPERATURE SUPERCONDUCTORS
CY JUL 22-26, 1991
CL KANAZAWA, JAPAN
SP CITY KANAZAWA, ISHIKAWA PREFECTURE
ID PHASE
AB From anomalies of the heat capacity and the thermal expansion, the structural phase boundary of the LTT-LTO transition is determined in the narrow range around x = 0.12 of La2-xBaxCuO4, where superconductivity is suppressed remarkably.  The widely-spread Cu-NQR spectra and the decay of the asymmetry parameter of mu-SR are indicative of the magnetic order of Cu moments in the LTT phase where the induced charge transfer between Cu and O atoms causes the localization of the electronic state and the increase of magnetic moments at the Cu site.

TI NEGATIVE MUON SPIN ROTATION STUDIES ON SINGLE-CRYSTAL LA2CUO4+DELTA
   ABOVE TN
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 3RD INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MATERIALS AND MECHANISMS OF SUPERCONDUCTIVITY
   : HIGH TEMPERATURE SUPERCONDUCTORS
CY JUL 22-26, 1991
CL KANAZAWA, JAPAN
SP CITY KANAZAWA, ISHIKAWA PREFECTURE
ID YBA2CU3O7
AB The negative muon spin rotation (mu-SR) experiments have been performed on the La2CuO4+delta single crystals (T(N) = 255K) in the paramagnetic region.  The temperature dependence of the two components of paramagnetic shift was obtained from the electron spectrum emitted from mu-O.  The hyperfine coupling constants, A(hf)1 and A(hf)2 (A(hf)1 > A(hf)2) obtained from the K - chi-plot are proposed to be ascribed to the O(1) and O(2) sites, respectively.

TI NEGATIVE MUON SPIN ROTATION IN YBA2CU3OX (X=7, 6.5 AND 6)
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 3RD INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MATERIALS AND MECHANISMS OF SUPERCONDUCTIVITY
   : HIGH TEMPERATURE SUPERCONDUCTORS
CY JUL 22-26, 1991
CL KANAZAWA, JAPAN
SP CITY KANAZAWA, ISHIKAWA PREFECTURE
AB By negative muon spin rotation method (mu-SR) the paramgnetic shifts of muonic oxygen, K-mu-, have been measured in the paramagnetic phase of YBa2Cu3O6; K-mu-is 4.6 +/- 1.9 x 10(-4) at 500 K and 8.7 +/- 1.7 x 10(4) at 550 K.  In the normal state of the superconducting YBa2Cu3O7, GdBa2Cu3O7 and YBa2Cu3O6.5 K-mu-'s have not been determined due to a very fast mu- spin relaxation time, T2star.  This mu-SR results in stoichiometric YBa2Cu3Ox makes a contarst with those in doped superconductor La2-xSrxCuO4-delta, in which T2star do not show any drastic change in superconducting and insulating phases.

TI THEORY OF POSITIVE MUON SPIN ROTATION IN LA2CUO4
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 3RD INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MATERIALS AND MECHANISMS OF SUPERCONDUCTIVITY
   : HIGH TEMPERATURE SUPERCONDUCTORS
CY JUL 22-26, 1991
CL KANAZAWA, JAPAN
SP CITY KANAZAWA, ISHIKAWA PREFECTURE
AB Crystal potential of La2CuO4 for a positive muon is calculated by adding the atomic potentials of La, Cu and O atoms which are calculated by spin-dependent self-consistent atomic Shrodinger equation.  We have found that the stable site for a positive muon is located in the interlayer region between two Cu-O planes.  Dipolar field and hyperfine field of Cu and O spin are calculated at the muon sites.  The calculated result shows that the hyperfine field from spin-polarized apical oxygen does contribute to the local field at the muon site and that the contact interaction of a positive muon is sensitive to the muon site and 2p orbital of apical oxygen.
RP SAITO, R (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO,FAC SCI,MESON SCI LAB,BUNKYO KU,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.
RI Saito, Riichiro/B-1132-2008

TI THEORY OF COPPER HYPERFINE INTERACTIONS IN THE LA2CUO4 SYSTEM
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW B
LA English
DT Article
ID NUCLEAR-QUADRUPOLE INTERACTION; HIGH-TC SUPERCONDUCTORS;
   SELF-CONSISTENT-FIELD; ANTIFERROMAGNETIC LA2CUO4-DELTA; IONIC-CRYSTALS;
   CU; RESONANCE; NMR; CU-63; NQR
AB The unrestricted Hartree-Fock cluster procedure is used to study the electronic structure of La2CuO4 and obtain the Cu-63 quadrupole coupling constant and asymmetry parameter of 88.4 MHz and 0.04, respectively, in satisfactory agreement with experiment.  A magnetic hyperfine field of 105.2 kG is obtained at the Cu-63 nucleus, as compared to 78.78 kG from experiment.  The effective charges on copper and oxygen ions and the mixing of copper and planar oxygen orbitals in the wave functions suggest significant covalent bonding between them.  The magnetic moment on the copper ion is reduced by the influence of the covalency effect and will be compared with experiment.
C1 UNIV FERRARA,DEPT PHYS,I-44100 FERRARA,ITALY.
   YAMANASHI UNIV,FAC ENGN,KOFU,YAMANASHI 400,JAPAN.
   UNIV TOKYO,FAC SCI,MESON SCI LAB,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.

TI THEORY OF ELECTRON DISTRIBUTIONS AND CU-63 AND O-17 NUCLEAR-QUADRUPOLE
   INTERACTIONS IN YBA2CU3O7 AND YBA2CU3O6
SO BULLETIN OF MATERIALS SCIENCE
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT INTERNATIONAL CONF ON SUPERCONDUCTIVITY
CY JAN 10-14, 1990
CL BANGALORE, INDIA
SP SUPERCONDUCT PROGRAMME MANAGEMENT BOARD INDIA, DEPT SCI & TECHNOL INDIA
DE ELECTRON DISTRIBUTION; NUCLEAR QUADRUPOLE INTERACTION; HARTREE-FOCK
   CLUSTERS
AB Ab initio unrestricted Hartree-Fock Cluster investigations have been carried out on the electronic structures of the YBa2Cu3O7 and YBa2Cu3O6 systems.  The results of these investigations provide satisfactory explanations of available Cu-63 and O-17 nuclear quadrupole interaction data.  The electron distributions obtained rule out the presence of Cu3+ ions and are supportive of the presence of Cu2+, Cu1+, O1- ions in the O7 system and Cu2+, Cu1+ and O2- in the O6 system with actual charges departing significantly from the formal charges, especially in the O7 system, indicating the importance of covalency effects.  Suggestions will be made regarding possible sources that can bridge the remaining gap between theoretical and experimental results for the nuclear quadrupole interaction parameters.
RP SULAIMAN, SB (reprint author), SUNY ALBANY,DEPT PHYS,ALBANY,NY 12222, USA.

PT J
AU SHIMOKOSHI, F

   YAMAZAKI, T
AF SHIMOKOSHI, F

   NAGAMINE, K
   YAMAZAKI, T
TI DEVELOPMENT OF A MULTISTOP TDC USING A SHIFT REGISTER FOR MUON DECAY
   MEASUREMENTS IN A PULSED-BEAM
SO NUCLEAR INSTRUMENTS & METHODS IN PHYSICS RESEARCH SECTION A-ACCELERATORS
   SPECTROMETERS DETECTORS AND ASSOCIATED EQUIPMENT
LA English
DT Article
AB New multistop CAMAC TDC modules using shift registers have been developed and were successfully used to measure the time spectrum of electrons from mu-->e-nu-nu-BAR decay in a high-intensity pulsed muon beam available at the UT-MSL/BOOM facility at KEK in Japan and after that also at Rutherford Appleton Laboratory.  The time resolution of the TDC is as good as 16 ns.  Among many features of the TDC, the combination of the shift register with fast memories is notable.  By adopting this, the time range of the TDC can be extendable beyond the shift register depth without losing time resolution.  The other feature is capability of making histograms in its own huge memories.  The principle of operation and the performance of the TDC are described.
C1 UNIV TOKYO,FAC SCI,MESON SCI LAB,BUNKYO KU,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.
RP SHIMOKOSHI, F (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO,FAC SCI,DEPT PHYS,7-3-1 HONGO,BUNKYO KU,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.

TI PROBING OXYGEN IN HIGH-TC SUPERCONDUCTOR LASRCUO BY NEGATIVE MUONS
SO HYPERFINE INTERACTIONS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 5TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MUON SPIN ROTATION RELAXATION AND RESONANCE
CY APR 09-12, 1990
CL OXFORD, ENGLAND
HO WADHAM COLL
ID VALENCE BOND STATE; OXIDES; YBA2CU3O7; SYSTEM
AB A novel microscopic method of muon spin rotation for negative muon (mu-) attached to oxygen is applied on high T(c) materials LaSrCuO.  The paramagnetic shift and relaxation rate are measured as a function of Sr concentration and temperature.  Analysis shows the large difference in shift and relaxation between two different sites.  A large anisotropy was also observed by preliminary measurements along different crystalline axes.

TI MU-SR STUDIES OF OXIDE-SUPERCONDUCTORS
SO HYPERFINE INTERACTIONS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 5TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MUON SPIN ROTATION RELAXATION AND RESONANCE
CY APR 09-12, 1990
CL OXFORD, ENGLAND
HO WADHAM COLL
ID YBA2CU3O7
AB The negative muon spin rotation method (mu-SR) has been applied to studies of electronic states at oxygen sites of oxide superconductors YBa2Cu3O7, Nd(2-x)Ce(x)CuO4-delta (x = 0.15, oxygen reduced), LiTi2O4 and related oxide-insulators La2CuO4-delta, CuO, Cu2O.  The paramagnetic shifts of mu- trapped at oxygen nuclei in these polycrystalline powder samples have been measured at 300 K.  All the measured shifts are positive.  In copper-oxides the paramagnetic shifts are of the order 10(-3), while in LiTi2O4 is very small (8.4 +/- 3.34 x 10(-5)).  In YBa2Cu3O7, a fast mu- spin relaxation time T2* (approximately 200 ns) has been observed; the reason for this is unknown and further studies are now in progress.
C1 NIPPON TELEGRAPH & TEL PUBL CORP,OPTOELECTR LABS,TOKAI,IBARAKI 31911,JAPAN.
   UNIV TOKYO,INST SOLID STATE PHYS,MINATO KU,TOKYO 106,JAPAN.

TI EVIDENCE FOR MUONIUM EMISSION FROM AN SIO2 LAYER ON N-TYPE SI AND THE
   POSITIVE MUON STATE IN SI
SO HYPERFINE INTERACTIONS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 5TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MUON SPIN ROTATION RELAXATION AND RESONANCE
CY APR 09-12, 1990
CL OXFORD, ENGLAND
HO WADHAM COLL
ID THERMAL MUONIUM; SPIN-RESONANCE; VACUUM; POWDERS
AB Evidence for the emission of slow muonium atoms from a 3.0-nm-thick SiO2 layer covered on an n-type Si is reported.  Also, upon applying an rf-resonance technique at the muon frequency, a time-differential observation of a delayed state-change from muonium to diamagnetic muon at room temperature was observed.  Combining results obtained by use of longitudinal field decoupling and transverse spin rotation methods, the conversion rate was estimated to be 5 to 10-mu-s-1.  Both of the above results, namely the observation of the emission and state-change of muonium, suggest a process in which mu-+ initially captures an electron from Si, then quickly converts to mu-+ again during thermal diffusion in the Si towards the SiO2 layer.  Within the oxide layer, muonium is again formed and subsequently is emitted from the SiO2 surface.
C1 UNIV TOKYO,INST SOLID STATE PHYS,MINATO KU,TOKYO 106,JAPAN.

TI APPLICATION OF PULSED HIGH MAGNETIC-FIELD TO MU-SR STUDIES
SO HYPERFINE INTERACTIONS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 5TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MUON SPIN ROTATION RELAXATION AND RESONANCE
CY APR 09-12, 1990
CL OXFORD, ENGLAND
HO WADHAM COLL
AB The technical development in the production of pulsed high magnetic field to be used for mu-SR studies is described.  A pulsed field up to 16 T with half-sine wave shape and 1 msec duration is repeated every 2 sec and the muon beam pulses are synchronized at the peak of the field.  Paramagnetic relaxation measurement on MnO has been performed at above 10 T as a test of this equipment and relaxation in PrCo2Si2 has been studied in the vicinity of the metamagnetic transition at 12 T at He temperature.
C1 UNIV TOKYO,FAC SCI,MESON SCI LAB,BUNKYO KU,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.

TI JAPANESE HADRON FACILITY PLANS AND FUTURE MU-SR
SO HYPERFINE INTERACTIONS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 5TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MUON SPIN ROTATION RELAXATION AND RESONANCE
CY APR 09-12, 1990
CL OXFORD, ENGLAND
HO WADHAM COLL
ID MUONIUM; VACUUM
AB The proposed next major science project in Japan, the high intensity 1 GeV proton accelerator with unique beam characteristics, is described here.  It will supply a proton beam of more than 100-mu-A in either dc mode or sharply pulsed mode (down to 10 ns), using a specially designed time structure conversion ring.  The beam will be used for keV mu+ generation at the production target, MeV surface mu+ production and 10 MeV decay mu+ and mu- production, as well as a possible slow mu- production.  All of these unique muon beams will be developed for the next generation of mu-SR experiments.  With the development of the keV mu+ source particularly in mind, a pilot station is now under construction at UT-MSL/KEK.  Possible new mu-SR experiments are also reviewed.
RP NAGAMINE, K (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO,MESON SCI LAB,BUNKYO KU,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.

TI SURFACE MUON PRODUCTION IN MEDIUM ENERGY HEAVY-ION REACTION AT RIKEN
SO HYPERFINE INTERACTIONS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 5TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MUON SPIN ROTATION RELAXATION AND RESONANCE
CY APR 09-12, 1990
CL OXFORD, ENGLAND
HO WADHAM COLL
AB A new type of beam transport system for secondary light charged particles ("Large OMEGA" Beam Course) has been constructed and used to transport surface muons from the decay of pions produced in heavy-ion reactions at RIKEN Ring Cyclotron (RRC).  In an experiment carried out using a N-14 beam of 135 MeV/u and a carbon target of 0.9 g/cm2 thickness, the surface muon intensity obtained in 5 x 5 cm2 sample was around 100 1/s for 500 nA of the primary beam.  This number may be increased by two orders if the energy were doubled.

TI MU-SR AND MOSSBAUER STUDIES ON SEMICONDUCTING
   YBA2(CU0.95FE0.05)3O6+DELTA

SP SCI & ENGN RES COUNCIL
HO WADHAM COLL
AB mu-SR and Fe-57 Mossbauer spectroscopy were used to study the magnetic properties of powders of semiconducting YBa, (Cu0.95 Fe0.05)3O6+delta using the same sample in the temperature range from 4-300 K.  TF and ZF mu-SR were performed at the BOOM facility at KEK using the pulsed surface beam.

TI MUON SPIN RELAXATION STUDY ON MAGNETISM IN HIGH-QUALITY SINGLE-CRYSTAL
   OF A HIGH TRANSITION-TEMPERATURE SUPERCONDUCTOR LA2-XSRXCUO4-DELTA
   (0.11-LESS-THAN-OR-EQUAL-TO-X-LESS-THAN-OR-EQUAL-TO-0.14)
SO HYPERFINE INTERACTIONS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 5TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MUON SPIN ROTATION, RELAXATION AND RESONANCE
CY APR 09-12, 1990
CL OXFORD, ENGLAND
SP SCI & ENGN RES COUNCIL
HO WADHAM COLL
ID ROTATION; LA1.85SR0.15CUO4; LA2CUO4; (LA1-XSRX)2CUO4; COEXISTENCE; STATE
AB The positive muon spin relaxation method is applied to probe magnetic ordering in the superconducting phase of a high quality single crystal of La(2-x)Sr(x)CuO4-delta (0.11 less-than-or-equal-to x less-than-or-equal-to 0.14).  The well characterized crystal of x = 0.11 (T(c) = 34.5 K) with nearly complete flux exclusion exhibits spin freezing at 8K(T(f)) with significant spin fluctuation up to 20 K.  The onset of spin fluctuation and T(f) decrease against increasing x towards x = 0.15, suggesting an existence of a magnetic phase boundary around x where T(c) becomes maximum.
